physical art.title: Physical art & architecture of the last 100 years
physical art.description: Art feeds the soul, and invites us all to feast.

photos.title: Two Human Hands
photos.para: Pen ink and watercolor render of a detail from the Sistine Chapel, of the hands of god and Adam.

photos.title: Architecture, Sydney, Australia
photos.para: Victorian sandstone buildings juxtaposed with modern skyscrapers.

pottery.title: Pottery
pottery.description: Pottery is the art of making ceramic material into pots or potterywares using clay. Major types of potterywares include earthenware, stoneware and porcelain. The place where such wares are made by a potter is also called a pottery (plural "potteries").

photos.title: Beautiful Japanese vessel
photos.para: A beautiful Japanese vessel, made of clay and fired in a kiln.

photos.title: Grey and white
photos.para: Raku fired pottery jugs, in a grey and white theme.

photos.title: Stoneware bowl
photos.para: Pottery or other ceramics fired at a relatively high temperature. A modern technical definition is a vitreous or semi-vitreous ceramic made primarily from stoneware clay or non-refractory fire clay. This example uses earthy copper and green tones as contrast.
